title: Miguel de Portilla y Esquivel
text:
Miguel de Portilla y Esquivel (1660–1732) was a Spanish writer, professor of <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> at the College of <a href="Justa%20and%20Rufina">Saints Justa and Rufina</a> of the <a href="University%20of%20Alcal%C3%A1">University of Alcalá</a>, and canon of the <a href="Alcal%C3%A1%20de%20Henares%20Cathedral">Alcalá de Henares Cathedral</a>.
Biography.
Miguel was born in <a href="Alcal%C3%A1%20de%20Henares">Alcalá de Henares</a> in May 1660. His father, the <a href="Alcal%C3%A1%20de%20Henares">Alcalaino</a> Baltasar de la Portilla Cierzo, was an <a href="apothecary">apothecary</a> in the town and became inspector of <a href="Pharmacy">chemists'</a> to the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Archdiocese%20of%20Toledo">Archbishop of Toledo</a>. His mother, María de Tendilla, was a native of <a href="Guadalajara%2C%20Spain">Guadalajara</a>, with Miguel as her second child.
In 1679, he entered the College of <a href="Justa%20and%20Rufina">Saints Justa and Rufina</a> in Alcalá, obtaining a <a href="doctorate">doctorate</a> in <a href="theology">theology</a> and later becoming a professor of <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Alcal%C3%A1">University of Alcalá</a>. He was also a <a href="Canonization">canon</a> of the <a href="The%20Magistral%20of%20the%20Holy%20Children%20Justo%20and%20Pastor">Magistral of the Holy Children Justo and Pastor</a>, and <a href="Pastor">Pastor</a> and Synodical Examiner of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Archdiocese%20of%20Toledo">Archbishop of Toledo</a>.
He died in Alcalá on 21 January 1732.
